intro: Psychotria horridula, commonly known as the rough psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a rough texture and its clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth. Psychotria horridula is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though its specific properties remain under study.
